Depending on the size of the WoMo, it can be tilted a little to the side, you only notice it when drinking coffee.

title_short: (18100) Urbanización los Vergeles - 4 Plaza Campus de la Salud
description: It's a public parking lot, across from a home improvement store. On the one hand it is illuminated and on the other it is shaded. We were looking for a place to stay and it was perfect for us. It's quiet, you can hear the cicadas. It's on the edge of a residential area and you're in town with easy noise from the freeway. No bus, no noise from loading, (a few streets away). We feel comfortable here and have a good feeling.

title: (18006) Urbanización los Vergeles - Calle Baden Powell
title_short: (18006) Urbanización los Vergeles - Calle Baden Powell

title: (18100) Armilla - 38 Calle Acequia del Olivillo
description: It is a huge flat field where people walk their dogs or they come to “park”. The view of the city and the snowy Sierra Nevada is pretty. Quiet, you can barely hear the cars.  Lidl and Nevada Shopping Center few minutes away. Not clean though…

title: (18100) Urbanización los Vergeles - 62 Carretera Granada
description: Parking at the edge of a fairly busy road. We slept a night without any problem. possibility to go see the historical places on foot. Carrefour supermarket next door.

title: (18007) Granada - Avda. Innovación - Parque Tecnológico
description: Very good starting point for sightseeing in Granada. Bus (green line 4) and tram right in front of the door, takes less than 20 minutes to get to the old town and doesn't cost much! The public parking lot costs just under 14 EUR a day. Parking in the center of Granada is hardly possible, at least on weekdays you look forever. So it's better that way and the camper is guarded. However, it is not really suitable for excess widths, at least there are no height restrictions.

title: (18100) Armilla - 25 Calle de Blas de Otero
title_short: (18100) Armilla - 25 Calle de Blas de Otero

title: (18100) Armilla - 13 Calle León
description: Parking in the city center, bus that takes you to Granada. Attention Monday morning, parking prohibited, due to market.

title: (18100) Armilla - 36 Calle Madrid

title: (18006) Granada - 8 Calle María Auxiliadora

We spent a quiet night there.

A little low for the AC, because of the trees there are.
We arrived at night looking for a place to sleep and there were several free parking spaces, there are more parking spaces on the opposite side of the street. In the morning it gets a little more crowded because people come to the science park. Otherwise very quiet.

title: (18014) Granada - 3P Avenida Federico García Lorca
description: Secure overnight parking. Next to sports pavilion, with several restaurants around

title: (18014) Granada - 7 Calle la Calera
description: Parked on condition.. safe and quiet

title: (18013) Granada - 32 Calle Iznájar
description: Some parking possibilities in a residential area. Shops nearby, a large shopping center and the main urban bus station.

title: (18014) Granada - 116D Avenida de Maracena
description: 50m from the tram, ideal for visiting Granada . Quiet night. No service. Spacious seats for large motorhomes. What more.

title: (18013) Granada -
description: Large parking between buildings in residential area. Next to the command of the civil guard. Safe and quiet For all sizes of motorhome and camper. Supermarket opposite and shops, pharmacy, bars and bakery in the surroundings. Very close to the bus stop. In the vicinity they ride a market on Sundays.

title: (18014) Granada - 10 Calle Torres
description: Parking in quiet residential area. Very spacious and far from buildings, next to a park with swings. Good for spending the night and parking during the day. Some car noises, but not too annoying.

title: (18140) La Zubia - Unnamed Road
description: Drinking water source for Motorhomes

title: (18140) La Zubia -
description: Playground with chess pin table and a path

title: (18195) Cúllar Vega - 150 Camino de las Galeras
title_short: (18195) Cúllar Vega - 150 Camino de las Galeras
description: Good place to visit the fertile plain of Granada. The lung of Granada! there are many flat paths to walk between the fields of tobacco or corn, pastry / bakery at 1 km open from Monday to Sunday on the street of La Vega 144. The bakery La Espiga. fresh bread. very recommendable shaded place, cafe at 200m

title: (18140) La Zubia - Unnamed Road
description: Place where there is a source with drinking water

title: (18630) Otura - 6 Camino de Alhendín
description: A quiet, flat wasteland, with a normal rubbish bin at the entrance, between two towns, the 4g network is great.

title: (18150) Gójar - 15 Camino Acequia Alta
description: Quiet parking

title: (18014) Granada - 162 Avenida de Maracena
description: Drinking fountain. You can park next to it if there is room, it is right next to a school

title: (18014) Granada - 103 Barrio PP-N3 Borde Norte
description: Ample and easy parking along the roads, near the motorway exit, with views of the Sierra Nevada, quiet area as it is new construction, next to a park with a water source. Tram 300 m away (JAEN stop) direction Armilla. To visit the Alhambra, get off at the "Recogidas" stop and from there walk about 2.2 km to the Alhambra, or take a taxi/Alhambra bus. It would certainly be possible to stay overnight as there were no prohibition signs, but it was certainly a bit noisy due to the cars driving past.

title: (18150) Gójar - 26 Camino de la Sierra
description: Water source

title: (18140) La Zubia - Unnamed road
description: A very quite location with amazing view of Granada and sierra Nevada. very big almost flat parking space and easy accessible from La Zubia. we were the only car here in June 2022

title: (18014) Granada - 2 Calle Calicasas
description: We stayed in this area encouraged by other colleagues. Quiet nights and hardly any people. The only noise is that of the tram that passes until 12 at night and early. Very close to the JAEN Metro stop that leaves you in the same Center. Nearby there is an Aldi and several restaurants. We slept 3 nights with no problem.

title: (18014) Granada - Avenida Federico García Lorca
description: This set of car parks along a low traffic lane is located in a new area of buildings under construction. Calm day and night, there are plenty of places nearby, allowing you to get to the city center of Granada by the nearby tram in about twenty minutes. The visit to the Alhambra took us 5 hours ( possibility to take the tickets on the spot without prior reservation in low season and early - an identity document is necessary for the entrance). We spent 2 nights there safely. Very good compromise to visit the city.

title: (18013) Granada - nº 104 Avenida de Juan Pablo II
title_short: (18013) Granada - nº 104 Avenida de Juan Pablo II
description: Wasteland ! Had a quiet night...nearby tram or bike ride to Granada center.

address.street: nº 104 Avenida de Juan Pablo II

title: (18009) Granada - Unnamed Road
description: Llano de la Perdiz. Very close to Granada with very nice views. Quiet place to spend as a family

title: (18140) La Zubia - Cta Corvales
description: In the middle of a fairly accessible forest. A few walkers during the day but absolutely calm! Many places to settle.

title: (18150) Gójar - 20 Calle Avila
description: Quiet parking

title: (18013) Granada - 4 Calle Casería del Cerro
description: Flat free large completely empty car park. 30 min walk from town. Quietish.

title: (18013) Granada - 6 Calle Casería Aguirre
description: Newly paved parking. At night with light. Spacious. 3 days without problem

title: (18011) Granada - 3 Calle de María Amaya La Gazpacha
title_short: (18011) Granada - 3 Calle de María Amaya La Gazpacha
description: Small quiet parking for. 3 motorhomes no service

address.street: 3 Calle de María Amaya La Gazpacha

title: (18150) Gójar - 16 Calle A
description: Paking with barbecues

title: (18620) Alhendín - 119 Carretera Bailén-Motril
description: Car wash with a tap that you can connect a hose to. There is also a laundromat next door. Forbidden to drain.

title: (18140) La Zubia - 16 Calle Cenes de la Vega
title_short: (18140) La Zubia - 16 Calle Cenes de la Vega
description: Place where there is a source with drinking water

title: (18193) Monachil - GR-3202
description: Parking at the cemetery just outside of Monarchil (approx. 1km to the start of the Los Cahorros circular trail).

title: (18150) Gójar - 18 Calle B
description: Quiet parking

title: (18009) Granada - Unnamed Road
description: Large car park with picnic tables above the Alhambra. At the Alhambra car park, continue on a gravel road then follow for about 4 km. For my Womo with 6.20 no problem, I would not recommend for bigger ones. Camping tents prohibited. Overnight in the motorhome was no problem. From 9 p.m. absolutely alone and quiet.

title: (18140) Cájar -
description: Room for a single van, we were not disturbed. In the morning a few hikers good spot at the edge of the Sierra Nevada

title: (18190) Cenes de la Vega - Camino del Río Genil
title_short: (18190) Cenes de la Vega - Camino del Río Genil
description: WARNING: This is location is for services only, inside the petrol station. Parking is at a separate location just next to this one! Some visitors in the comments mixed the two up! At the Galp petrol station you can discharge grey waters and uplift potable water. As you enter the station, stay on the left and park next to the sign for campers. Ask the attendant.

title: (18010) El Fargue -
description: A little further after an abandoned stadium, take the road that leads to the Abbey and about 100m away, two dirt roads go on either side towards nature spots. The view of the Sierra Nevada and the Alhambra are magnificent. Please respect the place and leave no waste, even if the locals do not apply these common sense measures.

title: (18190) Cenes de la Vega - Camino del Río Genil, 19C
title_short: (18190) Cenes de la Vega - Camino del Río Genil, 19C
description:
Parking next to a gas station. Quiet at night.
Bus 33 to Granada in 15 minutes. A bus approximately every 15 minutes. Bike lane to the center of Granada 5.6 km. In September it will increase its services with washing machines, showers and toilets, drinking water, and for the winter season they also have ski rental.

title: (18630) Alhendín - Carr. Bailen-Motril
description: A super motorhome workshop and you can park here for 24 hours...

title: (18197) Granada - 6 Calle Luis Buñuel
description: Parkin Mall. Mercadona, Declathon ... ideal before climbing to Sierra Nevada. Self-service laundry located inside the car park.

title: (18140) La Zubia - 9 Urbanizacion Suelo Urb. P-3
title_short: (18140) La Zubia - 9 Urbanizacion Suelo Urb. P-3
description: Place where there is a source with drinking water

title: (18010) El Fargue -
description: Abandoned sport field. Possible to park for the night

title: (18200) Maracena - 1 Avenida Ernesto Che Guevara
description: Very nice and green place to rest. Quiet area

title: (18010) -
description: Nice spot with a great point of view. We spent one night in a van, a quiet and safe place. Close to the road but not too noisy (little traffic at night). No convenience (no water point, no toilet, no shower) but in the middle of nature. No prohibition sign. A few minutes drive from the center of Granada.

title: (18190) Cenes de la Vega - 9 Calle del Mediterraneo
title_short: (18190) Cenes de la Vega - 9 Calle del Mediterraneo
description: Wash and Dry Laundromat 2022, open 365 a year. from 7 a.m. at 11 p.m.

title: (18190) Cenes de la Vega - 19 Poligono UE-5 Cerro del Sol
title_short: (18190) Cenes de la Vega - 19 Poligono UE-5 Cerro del Sol
description: Parking with plenty of well leveled spots. Area next to houses. It is quiet at night and very lit

title: (18200) Maracena - 1 Plaza Jose Antonio Atienza
description:
Parking next to the municipal pool, with a super cheap restaurant that eats great, it's called EMAUS catering restaurant, we parked to come to the pool and spend the afternoon since it was too hot, it's great, super friendly people.
swimming pool with bathrooms, showers, etc.

title: (18010) El Fargue - A-4002
description: A lovely place for a small camper. It is a dead end road, and is a lovely quite quiet spot for a small camper. We stayed one night. There is a lively restaurant nearby.

title: (18010) El Fargue - A 4002
description: Parking at the entrance of the village. Quiet area to sleep although busy during the day. It is attached to the road and during the day cars pass (not many). There are areas where the terrain is not straight. We dined and slept peacefully.

title: (18197) Pulianas - s/n Calle Boulevard Billy Wilder
title_short: (18197) Pulianas - s/n Calle Boulevard Billy Wilder
description: Big parking lot at a shopping center. Only during the day.

title: (18190) Cenes de la Vega - 2 Calle Equipamiento Deportivo
title_short: (18190) Cenes de la Vega - 2 Calle Equipamiento Deportivo
description: Stayed over the night next to polideportivo and the river with VW Crafter. There os also a parking place we saw MH. Wasn’t a problem to use the bathroom when the polideportivo was open. Next to the village with all the shops and services. Easy access. Quite noisy during the daytime, completely calm during the night. Stayed in mid of April. Close to the road leading to Sierra Nevada. Can hear some noise but not too much.

title: (18197) Andalusia - 4S Urbanizacion Ppi 03
description: Pitches on the edge of a quiet dead end street with little traffic. Next door a large shopping area.

title: (18197) Pulianas - 38 Urbanizacion Suelo Urbanizable Ind
description: Quiet parking directly behind the Aki DIY store. The car park is located behind a shopping center (Parque Granaita) with many shops and restaurants.

title: (18190) Cenes de la Vega - 15 Urbanizacion Suelo Urb Con Pp
title_short: (18190) Cenes de la Vega - 15 Urbanizacion Suelo Urb Con Pp
description: Parking without service. Nice point of view. Spacious. Paved road however, the rugged slopes and narrow parts.

title: (18630) Otura - 4 Carretera Bailen
description: Restaurant, hotel and lounges of multitudinous celebrations, next to the gas station that has a store.

title: (18190) Cenes de la Vega - 6 Camino de las Fuentezuelas
title_short: (18190) Cenes de la Vega - 6 Camino de las Fuentezuelas
description: Quiet place except for some kids with their cars (something temporary) On the banks of the Genil River. ideal for running or hitting a run. Free gym area. Fountain with drinking water. Totally flat. Bus number 33 stops quite close and leaves you in the center of Granada.

title: (18213) Jun - 2 Calle Miguel Valle - Tendero
description: Parking for the night 2 literal seconds from Granada, silent, it may seem a bit dingy but it is next to a good urbanization, nearby there is a commercial park

title: (18197) Pulianillas - 1 Avenida Huerta de San Anton
title_short: (18197) Pulianillas - 1 Avenida Huerta de San Anton
description: Simple gravel parking lot near the 'downtown'. Busy in the afternoon, but quiet at night.

title: (18193) Monachil - 9A Calle tras Torre
description: Public free parking in the center of Monachil next to a small river. Next to a street but not a lot of traffic. No prohibition signs. Police went by for a dog walk and didn't complain. Entry is a but steep but doable. There are 2 entries - one is less steep. Perfect starting point for hikes.

name: Finca Bellavista
title: (18200) Finca Bellavista
description:
Quiet and safe place, with 24-hour personalized attention, video surveillance cameras, closed area, with all services, showers, toilet, sink, washing machine, dryer, free Wi-Fi, rest area, large plots to put out awnings, chairs and tables.
Bus stop 200 meters away, tram stop 500 meters away (for 33 cents) directly to the center of Granada, taxi service, bakery service at 9 in the morning, supermarket 500 meters away, with bike path, with views of Sierra Nevada, near the A92 highway, entrance via GR30, exit 5.
